title.value: Bugs in Machine Learning-based Systems: A Faultload Benchmark
title.justification: This is the exact title of the paper as stated at the beginning of the document.
title.quote: Bugs in Machine Learning-based Systems: A Faultload Benchmark

extractions.description: This paper discusses the challenges of reproducing and verifying bugs in Machine Learning (ML)-based systems and introduces a faultload benchmark named defect4ML. The benchmark consists of 100 real bugs collected from GitHub and Stack Overflow, aiming to help researchers and practitioners assess their testing tools and techniques for ML-based systems.

type.justification: The paper focuses on practical aspects such as reproducibility, verifiability, and challenges of generating a benchmark of bugs in ML-based software systems. It also discusses the collection and analysis of real bugs from various sources, which is typical of empirical studies.
type.quote: In this study, we firstly investigate the reproducibility and verifiability of the bugs in ML-based systems and show the most important factors in each one.

name.justification: The focus of the paper is on improving the reliability of ML-based systems by creating a benchmark of bugs. The paper discusses Software Reliability Engineering (SRE) methodologies related to ensuring failure-free operations of the software.
name.quote: Software Reliability Engineering (SRE) is the methodology to ensure failure-free operations of the software in a specified period of time.

name.justification: The main contribution of the paper is a faultload benchmark named defect4ML, which satisfies standard benchmark criteria and helps in evaluating and comparing bug detection and fixing techniques.
name.quote: defect4ML also addresses important challenges in Software Reliability Engineering of ML-based software systems, like: 1) fast changes in frameworks, by providing various bugs for different versions of frameworks, 2) code portability, by delivering similar bugs in different ML frameworks, 3) bug reproducibility, by providing fully reproducible bugs with complete information about required dependencies and data, and 4) lack of detailed information on bugs, by presenting links to the bugsâ€™ origins.

name.justification: The paper highlights the importance of testing in ML-based systems and introduces a standard benchmark to evaluate different testing tools and techniques for these systems.
name.quote: defect4ML can be of interest to ML-based systems practitioners and researchers to assess their testing tools and techniques.

name.justification: The dataset called defect4ML is a major contribution of this paper, consisting of 100 real bugs in ML-based systems extracted from GitHub and Stack Overflow.
name.quote: we explore the challenges of generating a benchmark of bugs in ML-based software systems and provide a bug benchmark namely defect4ML that satisfies all criteria of standard benchmark

referenced_paper_title.value: This paper, "Bugs in Machine Learning-based Systems: A Faultload Benchmark," is the primary source and reference for defect4ML.
referenced_paper_title.justification: defect4ML is introduced and thoroughly described within the scope of this paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: We also provide a faultload benchmark of ML-based systems namely defect4ML.

name.justification: TensorFlow is mentioned as one of the most popular ML frameworks used to collect and analyze bugs in the paper.
name.quote: This faultload benchmark contains 100 bugs reported by ML developers in GitHub and Stack Overflow, using two of the most popular ML frameworks: TensorFlow and Keras.

referenced_paper_title.value: Abadi, M., Barham, P., Chen, J., Chen, Z., Davis, A., Dean, J., Devin, M., Ghemawat, S., Irving, G., Isard, M., et al. Tensorflow: A system for large-scale machine learning. In: 12th {USENIX} symposium on operating systems design and implementation ({OSDI} 16):265-283. USENIX, Savannah, GA, USA (2016).
referenced_paper_title.justification: This is the seminal paper describing TensorFlow, which is referenced when discussing the ML frameworks in this paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: For TensorFlow, see: Abadi, M., Barham, P., Chen, J., Chen, Z., Davis, A., Dean, J., Devin, M., Ghemawat, S., Irving, G., Isard, M., et al. Tensorflow: A system for large-scale machine learning. In: 12th {USENIX} symposium on operating systems design and implementation ({OSDI} 16):265-283. USENIX, Savannah, GA, USA (2016).

name.justification: Keras is mentioned as one of the most popular ML frameworks used to collect and analyze bugs in the paper.
name.quote: This faultload benchmark contains 100 bugs reported by ML developers in GitHub and Stack Overflow, using two of the most popular ML frameworks: TensorFlow and Keras.

referenced_paper_title.value: Chollet, F. et al. Keras: The Python Deep Learning Library. Astrophysics Source Code Library, 2018.
referenced_paper_title.justification: This is the seminal paper describing Keras, which is referenced when discussing the ML frameworks in this paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: For Keras, see: Chollet, F. et al. Keras: The Python Deep Learning Library. Astrophysics Source Code Library, 2018.
